thread.title: JMR Electronics Announces General Availability of Portable Thunderbolt SSD Flash Drive
thread.title_full: JMR Electronics Announces General Availability of Portable Thunderbolt SSD Flash Drive - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: JMR Electronics Announces General Availability of Portable Thunderbolt SSD Flash Drive
text:
JMR's among the first to ship new portable, ultra-compact Thunderbolt 2 equipped SSD Flash Drive
Chatsworth, CA, (PRWEB) October 13, 2015
JMR Electronics, Inc . a leading manufacturer and systems integrator of scalable storage solutions announced today the general availability of their new Lightning LTNG-XTD portable Thunderbolt SSD Flash Drive .
The ultra-compact PCIe Flash Drive with Thunderbolt 2 interface is a portable bus-powered drive requiring no external power source, and is introduced with 256GB storage capacity, with 512GB and 1.02TB models being added in the future. The new SSD drive is the ideal high performance alternative to USB thumb drives, portable SATA based hard disk drives, and current SSD storage products in the market. It easily connects to a compatible Mac® or Windows computer with a Thunderbolt port, or at the end of a Thunderbolt device daisy chain, via its attached Thunderbolt cable.
The LTNG-XTD SSD Flash Drive leverages the latest generation M.2 PCIe SSD technology, coupling a 20Gb/s Thunderbolt 2 interface that provides real world sustained read and write file transfer speeds of between 1,200 to 1,400 MB/s. The unit incorporates a PCIe Generation 3 flash controller, enabling it to easily outperform 6Gb/s SATA SSDs and 5Gb/s USB 3.0 flash drives. The flash drive is compatible and certified for use with OS X (including Yosemite) and Windows® 7+ OS.
To keep the size ultra-compact, the new LTNG-XTD SSD Flash Drive has an integrated anodized aluminum finned heat sink covering its entire surface area which allows sustained, silent operation 24/7 while significantly extending its life span.
"Intel is pleased to work with JMR to bring to market one of the industry's first bus-powered Thunderbolt 2 PCIe SSD storage devices," said Jason Ziller, Director of Thunderbolt Marketing, Intel Corporation. "Thunderbolt PCIe SSD Flash Drives such as JMR's newly released LTNG-XTD portable SSD demonstrate what is possible with Thunderbolt technology, setting new milestones for performance, portability and affordability for the industry."
"We are delighted to be working with Intel to be among the first to bring to market our Thunderbolt 2 equipped SSD Flash Drive," added Josef Rabinovitz, president and CEO of JMR Electronics. "The LTNG-XTD is the ideal, portable and ultra light-weight storage complement for creative and business professionals needing a high performance shuttle drive for in-house and offsite workflows — from viewing and editing digital dailies, to being used as a scratch disk, ruggedized transport medium or back-up tool."
The new LTNG-XTD portable Thunderbolt SSD is part of the new Lightning family of Thunderbolt certified storage products from JMR Electronics.
About JMR Electronics
JMR is a leading value provider and systems integrator of scalable storage systems for high performance and capacity driven applications for multiple markets including; video and post-production, military and government, education, VOD, DCC, gaming, security, medical imaging, HPC and Web 2.0. Since 1982, JMR’s reliable and innovative RAID systems are proudly made in the U.S.A., manufactured entirely from their Chatsworth, California facilities. JMR’s complete line of affordable Lightning storage products; SilverStor SMB focused products, and BlueStor Cloud-ready rackmount and desktop solutions are built to handle the most demanding project needs for A/V centric markets. Reliability. Innovation. Performance. This is JMR. For further information please visit http://www.jmr.com or contact sales(at)jmr(dot)com, or call 818-993-4801.
